results.overview: At P.S. 76 we provide rigorous, standards based instruction to establish the necessary foundation for our scholars to become literate, caring, responsible citizens and life-long learners prepared for college and careers.  P.S. 76 stakeholders foster an environment that acknowledges and respects diversity, by cultivating student genius and in doing so, creates a love of learning, which not only increases their confidence, but also supports academic and social-emotional growth.  Our school uses data to set goals and implements progress monitoring tools to monitor student learning and provide scholars with specific and timely feedback to help them meet their goals.

results.overview:
Welcome to PS85Q!
At PS85Q, we are committed to fostering a nurturing and engaging learning environment for all our students. Located in the vibrant community of Astoria, Queens, our school serves families from diverse backgrounds, embracing inclusivity and cultural richness.
Mission Statement
Our mission at Public School 85 Queens is to create a safe, nurturing environment, which fosters academic and social achievement for all students.  We acknowledge the diversity of our school community and strive to build an inclusive curricula aligned with the needs of our students. We strive for excellence as we develop the foundational skills needed to produce well-rounded, life-long learners that aim towards college and career readiness through the collaboration of students, teachers, and families.
PS85Q’s Approach to Teaching and Learning
1. Student-Centered Learning:
   - We prioritize the individual needs of our students. Our educators use differentiated instruction strategies to tailor lessons that meet diverse learning styles and paces.
   - Small group work, hands-on activities, and interactive lessons keep students engaged and motivated.
2. Social-Emotional Learning (SEL):
   - PS85Q integrates SEL into our curriculum, helping students develop essential skills like empathy, self-regulation, and teamwork. We provide a safe space for students to express their emotions and build strong interpersonal relationships.
3. Project-Based Learning:
   - In Kindergarten our unique programming includes project-based learning initiatives that connect classroom concepts to real-world applications. Students collaborate on meaningful projects, enhancing their problem-solving skills and fostering teamwork.
 Unique Programming
1. Cultural Enrichment:
   - PS85Q celebrates the rich diversity of our community through various cultural programs and events. Students participate in  respect and understanding of different cultures.
2. Family Engagement:
   - We believe that strong partnerships with families are essential for student success. Our Kindergarten involves our parents and caregivers in the educational journey of their children.

PS85Q Astoria Queens is dedicated to creating a dynamic and supportive educational experience for all students. We invite prospective families to join our community, where together we can inspire a passion for learning and prepare our children for a successful future. We look forward to welcoming you to our school! No additional priority is given to zoned students for the Gifted & Talented program at this school.

results.overview:
PS 87 is a PK-5 primary school serving families on the Upper West Side. As a school, we recognize that to advance each student through their individualized instructional path, we must teach - and know - the whole child. By encouraging our community members to follow our four tenets - be kind, wise, brave, and honest - we hope to promote inclusion and acceptance academically, socially, and emotionally. 

To achieve our mission, we teach students through deep, thematic units of study heavily steeped in science and social studies.  Through these units, students can apply the skills they have learned in literacy and mathematics as they also learn to think critically about the world around them using multiple learning modalities.  To enrich the children's academic experience at PS 87, we have partnerships with the National Dance Institute, Dancing Classrooms, Center for Architecture, Symphony Space, Art Farm, Ajna Dance, and Jazz a Lincoln Center.

results.overview:
PS 88Q, The Seneca School, is a dynamic educational environment where project-based learning and critical thinking are integral to the students' day. PS 88Q provides rich, immersive experiences across a variety of disciplines, fostering creativity and analytical skills. At PS 88Q, the arts play a vital role, with programs in music, theater, dance, and visual arts allowing students to express themselves while gaining valuable collaborative and problem-solving skills.

In addition to its strong arts programs, PS 88Q offers Dual Language- Spanish as a kindergarten program, where students develop bilingual proficiency and biliteracy. Additionally, we are a proud Nest School, (https://steinhardt.nyu.edu/metrocenter/nest) affiliated with NYU.  

The school is also home to a robust STEM ICT program that emphasizes innovation, critical thinking, and hands-on learning. With a focus on technology and engineering, students engage in MakerSpace activities, 3D printing, coding, and more, preparing them for the future.

PS 88Q offers numerous opportunities for students with disabilities, ensuring they are supported through personalized instruction and programs designed to meet their unique needs. With its dedication to inclusive education, the school empowers all students to succeed both academically and sociallyâ This school has ASD Nest: Open to students currently enrolled in the ASD (Autism Spectrum Disorder) Nest program. If you are applying to ASD programs for the first time, please visit www.schools.nyc.gov/specializedprograms for the application and contact ASDprograms@schools.nyc.gov with questions.

results.overview:
P.S. 91 is a Performing Arts Elementary School in the University Heights section of the Bronx serving approximately 360 students in grades K-5. Principal Nasjletti has been leading the school for 15 years.  It is presently a school in good standing in terms of NYSED accountability. We provide General Education, Special Education (ICT, Self-Contained, and Horizon), English as a New Language (ENL), and Bilingual classroom settings. We provide mandated services that include ENL support, counseling, SETSS, occupational therapy, physical therapy, and mono and bilingual speech therapy. Student attendance is our top priority. The school's attendance goal is to reach 100%.

SPECIAL INITIATIVES: 

ARTS: We are very proud of our ever-growing Arts program. We offer classes in visual and performing arts, including music, art, theater, and dance.  Our certified music teacher organizes concerts in the Winter and Spring that are enjoyed by the entire school community, including parents and elected officials. Our certified art teacher provides instruction in art which includes painting, drawing, designing, and photography. Our Arts program is also supported by outside partnerships including  dancing Classrooms, Jazz at Lincoln Center, Rosie’s Theater Kids, Young People's Chorus of NYC, and Materials for the Arts. These art programs have had a positive impact on parental involvement and increased the opportunities to invite parents into our school. Besides the Arts, we offer academic,  chess, soccer, and basketball after-school programs. The Autism Horizon Program supports students with autism in a special class with eight students, a special education teacher and paraprofessional with emphasis on building skills and offering opportunities for meaningful inclusion in larger settings. Students in this program may need additional academic support and require speech and language services, including in areas of social or pragmatic communication. For more information, speak with your CSE or IEP team and refer to Specialized Programs for Students with Disabilities (nyc.gov).

results.overview: Magnet schools are public school options that provide a school-wide curriculum designed around a specific theme. They are intended to attract a diverse pool of applicants and historically have accommodated students from outside their zone or district. While some schools may have the word "magnet" in their school's name, only a school that currently gets Magnet Schools Assistance Program (M.S.A.P) funding is labeled as a "magnet school" on it's MySchools page. This magnet school offers a school-wide curriculum around the theme of Engineering, Architecture, and the Arts. Enrollment in kindergarten to sixth grade in a public elementary does not guarantee school bus service. For more information please visit schools.nyc.gov/BusEligibility.

results.overview: Welcome to Mary McLeod Bethune School/P.S. 92.  Kindergarten is a special time in a students life and choosing the right school for your scholar is crucial.  Parents trust their most precious children to schools for various reasons.  Send your child to Bethune because our Bethune family truly cares for children.  We are a small, tight knit school with staff who are committed to enriching the lives of children.  Our mission is aligned to the legacy of Mary McLeod Bethune to encourage our youth, recognize their potential, and to help them build a better world.  A feeling of belonging is important to us and we recognize and celebrate the diversity within our school building.  We expose all students to performance arts and visual arts in addition to their daily academics.  We believe in health and wellness for students as well as staff.  At Bethune, your child will be known by name by all and greeted warmly daily.  We will communicate with you often and invite you in to learn alongside us. New York City helps to shape our classrooms.  Our students experience a number of field trips aligned to our curriculum and health and wellness.  We invite you to make outreach to set up a tour of our beautiful school. The Autism Horizon Program supports students with autism in a special class with eight students, a special education teacher and paraprofessional with emphasis on building skills and offering opportunities for meaningful inclusion in larger settings. Students in this program may need additional academic support and require speech and language services, including in areas of social or pragmatic communication. For more information, speak with your CSE or IEP team and refer to Specialized Programs for Students with Disabilities (nyc.gov).

results.overview: William H. Prescott Elementary School (13K093) is a community of learners who are dedicated to improving the lives of our scholars by working tirelessly to improve proficiency in numeracy and literacy. In 2021, The William H. Prescott Elementary School was designated a Magnet School by the New York State Education Department with a focus on Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Mathematics (S.T.E.A.M.) PS. 93, located in the Bedford Stuyvesant section of Brooklyn, New York, currently serves scholars in grades 3K â 5, 18% of students with individualized education plans and 17% English language learners of whom who speaks, Arabic, Bengali, Spanish, French, and English. We offer programs that support and enrich the academic, cultural, and social development of our diverse body of scholars by partnering with the following organizations: Studio in a School, Splat Lab, LEAP, Brooklyn Youth Chorus, Noel Pointer Violin Program, New York Junior Tennis Learning (NYJTL), Replications. We are dedicated in carrying out our schoolâs vision and mission.  We welcome our scholars, affirm their backgrounds and identities, and partner with our families and the community. We ensure high expectations and provide rigorous instruction for each scholar grounded in the S.T.E.A.M. educational emphasis. We engage our scholars in personalized hands-on learning experiences that cultivate real world-knowledge with access to inquiry, dialogue, and critical thinking skills. We provide support systems and develop the whole child, fostering collaboration, social consciousness, cultural awareness, and acceptance to meet the needs of our changing world.
